Button.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for background (block).

Button.name: --button-palette-background-normal
Button.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for background.

Button.name: --button-palette-background-bold
Button.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for background / border-color (outline) / color (clear).

Button.name: --button-palette-foreground-normal
Button.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for color.

Button.name: --button-gap
Button.description: Controls the spacing gap between child elements, e.g. icons.

Button.name: active
Button.description: Renders the Button with aria-pressed attribute, and styles the Button as if it where being clicked.

Button.name: disabled
Button.description: Renders the Button with disabled / aria-disabled attributes, and styles the Button partially transparent.

Button.name: type
Button.description: Renders the Button as a <input /> as a specific form type.

Button.name: name
Button.description: Sets the form name of the Button whenever Button.type is set.

Button.name: value
Button.description: Sets the form value of the Button whenever Button.type is set.

Button.name: href
Button.description: Renders the Button as a <a role="button"> and links to the specified href property.

Button.name: download
Button.description: If linking to a downloadable file, this property will be used as the suggested file name.

Button.name: rel
Button.description: Sets how the Anchor relates to the current page, see MDN for more information.

Button.name: target
Button.description: Sets the target of the Anchor being navigated, see MDN for more information.

Button.name: for
Button.description: Renders the Button as a <label role="button"> which targets the element ID set to the for property.

    </Button>

    <Button for="button-types-label">

    </Button>

    <Button value="This is an INPUT Button!" />

    <Button
        type="submit"
        value="This is a SUBMIT Button!"
    />

    <Button
        type="reset"
        value="This is a RESET Button!"
    />
</Stack>
snippets.title: Button Types

data.render:
Button

Button is used to usually trigger an action in the Web Application, such as submitting forms or opening an Overlay.

Imports

<script>
    import {Button} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

Palette

You can change the color palette of the Button via the palette property.

Size

You can change the size of the Button via the size property.

Clear

Button components have a special variation that renders as text with no background, that lightly fills in when clicked.

Outline

Button components have a special variation that renders them as text with an outline, the fills in when clicked.

Types

You can change make the Button a <a> by passing the href property, or a <label> by passing the for property. And also, change the input type between <input type="button" /> (DEFAULT), <input type="reset" />, <input type="submit" /> via the type / value properties.
